title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #146: Turán Numbers for Bipartite r-Degenerate Graphs**

**Conjecture:** If H is bipartite and r-degenerate, then ex(n;H) ≪ n^{2-1/r}.

**Status:** OPEN (even for r = 2!)

**Prize:** $500

**Best Known:** n^{2-1/4r} by Alon-Krivelevich-Sudakov (2003)
mathContext: The Turán number ex(n;H) is the maximum edges in an n-vertex H-free graph. The conjecture relates it to degeneracy, a local structural property.

title: r-Degenerate Graph
content:
**IsRDegenerate:**

A graph is r-degenerate if every induced subgraph has minimum degree ≤ r.

**Equivalent:** Vertices can be ordered so each has ≤ r neighbors among later vertices.

**Examples:** Trees are 1-degenerate, planar graphs are 5-degenerate.

title: Turán Number
content:
**turanNumber ex(n; H):**

The maximum number of edges in an n-vertex graph that contains no copy of H as a subgraph.

**Classic Result:** ex(n; K_r) = (1 - 1/(r-1))n²/2 (Turán's theorem)

**For bipartite H:** ex(n; H) = o(n²) by Kővári-Sós-Turán.

title: The Erdős-Simonovits Conjecture
content:
**ErdosSimonovitsConjecture (1984):**

For bipartite r-degenerate H:
ex(n; H) ≪ n^{2-1/r}

**Meaning:** The extremal exponent depends ONLY on r, not on other structure of H.

**Significance:** Would give a complete classification of bipartite Turán numbers.

title: AKS Theorem (2003)
content:
**Alon-Krivelevich-Sudakov:**

For bipartite r-degenerate H:
ex(n; H) ≪ n^{2-1/4r}

**Note:** This is weaker than the conjecture by a factor of 4 in the exponent.

**Method:** Uses dependent random choice technique.

title: AKS Special Case
content:
**Full Bound for Bounded-Side-Degree:**

When H is bipartite with max degree r in one side of the bipartition, the full bound ex(n;H) ≪ n^{2-1/r} holds.

**This includes:** K_{r,s} for any s ≥ r.

title: Gap Between Bounds
Complete Bipartite Graphs
content:
**completeBipartiteGraph K_{r,s}:**

Vertices split into sets of size r and s, with all edges between them.

**Key Property:** K_{r,s} is r-degenerate (when r ≤ s).

**Kővári-Sós-Turán:** ex(n; K_{r,s}) = Θ(n^{2-1/r}) - the conjecture holds!

title: The r = 2 Case
content:
**Even r = 2 is Open:**

For 2-degenerate bipartite graphs:
- Conjecture: ex(n;H) ≪ n^{3/2}
- AKS: ex(n;H) ≪ n^{15/8}

**Example:** C_4 (4-cycle) is 2-degenerate.
ex(n; C_4) = Θ(n^{3/2}) is known (Bondy-Simonovits).

So the conjecture holds for some 2-degenerate graphs, but not all are understood.

title: Summary: OPEN
content:
**Erdős Problem #146:**

**STATUS:** OPEN ($500 prize)

**Conjecture:** ex(n;H) ≪ n^{2-1/r} for bipartite r-degenerate H

**Best Known:** n^{2-1/4r} (AKS 2003)

**Special Cases:** Proved for K_{r,s} and bounded-side-degree

**Key Insight:** Local structure (degeneracy) should determine global extremal behavior, but proving this remains elusive.
